dt.t: … the ideal failed once again to {wi}correspond{/wi} with the reality …
The number of ballots cast should {wi}correspond{/wi} to the number of people present.
In some countries, the role of president {wi}corresponds{/wi} to that of prime minister.

dt: {bc}to communicate with a person by exchange of letters

et: Middle French or Medieval Latin; Middle French {it}correspondre{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}correspondēre{/it}, from Latin {it}com-{/it} + {it}respondēre{/it} to respond
shortdef: to be in conformity or agreement
to compare closely : match —usually used with to or with
